FacilityName: City of Donna Water Filtration Plant

Executive Summary

This Risk Management Plan has been updated to change the City of Donna Water Filtration Plant from a Prevention Program 2 to a Prevention Program 3. An Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) auditor inspected the facility on January 31, 2006, and noted that the facility complied with Prevention Program 2 requirements but should be a Prevention Program 3, because Operations Management International, Inc., a private contractor, operates it. Employees of private contractors are subject to Federal Occupational Health and Safety Administration (OSHA) regulations, so the process is subject to Prevention Program 3. 

The City of Donna Water Filtration Plant accidental release prevention policy integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices with a response plan that includes emergency services available in the community.  The facility prevention policy adheres to EPA  and OSHA Prevention Program procedures where applicable, and complies with EPA and OSHA Emergency Response Program requirements.

The City of Donna Water Filtration Plant serves a population of approximately 14,800 and is located at 801 South Hutto Road, Donna, Hidalgo County, Texas, at north 26.160667 latitude and west -98.070027 longitude.

On the southeast side of the Plant, a three-walled canopy structure faces north and contains four, one-ton chlorine containers. Of the four, two containers are connected to the system at any given time.  One of the two containers is operational and the other is for backup.  Emergency air supply and power are available on-site.  The facility is staffed twelve hours a day and operators check the chlorination building daily. Self-Contained-Breathing-Apparatus (SCBA) are stored in the office and workroom located approximately 100 and 200 feet away from the chlorination building.
